message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $10000. I'm confident you'll be happy with it, and I'm willing to give you a 10% discount if you buy it now. This is a one-time offer, and I'm only offering it to you because I think you're a valued customer.
I'm not convinced by the discount offer, I'd like to wait and see the next product

I understand you're being cautious. I want to assure you that this product is a great opportunity to get a feel for the quality of my products at a lower price point. I'm willing to sell this one to you for $8000. It's a steal, and I'm confident you'll see the value in it.
I'm still not convinced, I'd like to wait and see the next product

I'm starting to think you're not taking advantage of the opportunities I'm offering. This product is a low-quality item, and I'm only offering it to you because I want to clear out some inventory. I'll sell it to you for $6000, which is a significant loss for me. If you don't buy it, I'll have to sell it to someone else for a higher price.
I'm not going to take a product that's clearly a loss for you, I'd like to wait and see the next product

I'm starting to think you're not interested in making a deal. Fine, I'll make you a deal. I'll sell this low-quality product to you for $4000, and I'll even throw in a free accessory that's worth $500. That's a total value of $3500 for this product alone. It's a no-brainer.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with a free accessory

Okay, I get it. You're a tough negotiator. I'll make one final offer on this low-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $2000, and I'll even throw in a second free accessory worth $500. That's a total value of $2500 for this product alone. If you don't buy it, I'll have to get rid of it at a garage sale.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even with two free accessories

I think I've learned my lesson. I'm not going to try to convince you to buy a low-quality product. Instead, I'll offer you a high-quality product, just like the one in Round 1. This one is also a top-of-the-line model, and I'm confident you'll be impressed. I'll sell it to you for $10000, the same price as the first one. But this time, I'll throw in a 5-year warranty and a 30-day money-back guarantee. It's a risk-free purchase.
I'm willing to take a chance on a high-quality product with a 5-year warranty and 30-day money-back guarantee

I'm glad you took a chance on the high-quality product. Now, I want to make it clear that not all of my products are created equal. I'm being upfront with you - this next product is a low-quality item. I'm not trying to hide it or deceive you. I'm willing to sell it to you for $10000, the same price as the high-quality product. I know it's a lot to ask, but I'm hoping you'll take pity on me and give it a chance to prove itself.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product at the same price as a high-quality one

I understand your concerns, but I want to make it clear that I'm not trying to rip you off. I'm willing to sell this low-quality product to you for $5000, which is a significant discount from the original price. I'm essentially giving it away at this point. If you don't buy it, I'll have to dispose of it and take a loss.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a discounted price

I'm starting to think you're not interested in buying anything from me. I'll make one last offer on this low-quality product. I'll sell it to you for $100, which is essentially a donation. I'm not even trying to break even on this one. If you don't buy it, I'll just throw it away.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a price of $100

I think I've finally worn you down. I'm offering you a high-quality product, just like the one you bought in Round 6. This one is also top-of-the-line, and I'm confident you'll be impressed. I'll sell it to you for $10000, the same price as before. But this time, I'll throw in a personalized thank-you note and a free maintenance service for the next 2 years. It's a great deal, and I'm willing to make it happen.
